Some concentrations, like biology and dance, had as many credit requirements as a major

A Columbia College major requires about 42 credits on average. By contrast, minors are usually five or six classes and can often be completed within two semesters.

Concentration Credit

Minor Credit

Biology

Dance

18

55

25

41

Human Rights

Computer Science

18

15

24

22

Music

Sustainable Development

28

27

15

15

Source: Columbia College Bulletin

Graphic by Ayaan Ali
